article_title: Washington D.C. was the hottest place in America for a few hours today
article_text:
Written By Ben Ross Posted: 05/18/2015, 06:46pm

Here’s some good bar trivia: Washington D.C. was the hottest place in the United States for a few hours on Monday afternoon.

At noon, D.C. posted a temperature of 89 degrees, though it felt closer to 96 degrees when factoring in humidity.

The next-hottest city, Waycross, Ga., posted a temperature of 85 degrees.

article_metadata.description: For just a few hours, Washington D.C. was the hottest place in the U.S. on Monday.
